The plant produces yellowish-green flower spikes during the winter months, which are followed by flat, pod-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Acacia acrionastes is adapted to sandy soils and salt-laden environments, making it resilient to coastal conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for various small animals and insects.
